name: Adapto
description:
Adapto is a fast-paced survival game where depending on what towers you place,  the enemies evolve to counter it. There are three main types of towers: water, fire and steel. Each type of tower can be upgraded once to become more powerful, yet this is more costly, and you can only use so many build points per round. Different towers do differing amounts of damage to different enemy types -  if they differ, they are less effective. In this way, in order to survive your defence constantly has to be adapting in order to survive against the evolving enemies.

Controls: Left click to place a tile, right click to remove it. Press space to toggle material, and use the scroll-wheel to toggle between walls and towers.

Notice: This game had an incredibly rushed development cycle, is wrought with bugs, and is really only a prototype (if that). No time at all was spared for polishing and the UI is incredibly rough too. We only released it (1 minute before the deadline) so that the concept itself can be judged, not the content.

P.S. Health bars don't work on tiles due to a bug in a specific Unity version's UI rendering.
